page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: The A27 is a by-pass for Havant.It meets the A3M at Bedhampton in a massive junction that contains 8 bridges.A fly-over is being built at Langstone at the A27/A3023 junction.A dual-carriageway connects West Leigh and Havant centre.Before the by-pass was built,the A27 went through the centre of Havant(now a pedestrian precinct)and through Bedhampton and Farlington.There is a main railway station at Havant and a halt at Bed- hampton.There are 90 trains a day to and from London.Fare to London:Â£14.80 (return),journey time:80minutes.There are 12 bus services in the area,going to Portsmouth,Chichester,etc.as well as fast coach services all over the country.Many people use cars rather than public transport.There are traffic jams at peak times on many roads.
